results.title: Metformin radiosensitizes OSCC in 2D and 3D models: possible involvement of CAF-1.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ downmodulated the expression of the major subunits of @GENE_CHAF1A @GENE_10036 @@@CAF-1@@@, and the knockdown of this protein by siRNAs elicited a @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@-like effect on cell @<m>DISEASE_Personality_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010554 @@@aggressiveness@@@.

citations.NLM: Palazzo M, Novizio N, Belvedere R, Oliviero C, Pacelli R, Merolla F, Staibano S, Petrella A. Metformin radiosensitizes OSCC in 2D and 3D models: possible involvement of CAF-1. Pathologica. 2024 Dec;116(6):404-416. PMID: 39748725
citations.BibTeX: @article{39748725, title={Metformin radiosensitizes OSCC in 2D and 3D models: possible involvement of CAF-1.}, author={Palazzo M and Novizio N and Belvedere R and Oliviero C and Pacelli R and Merolla F and Staibano S and Petrella A}, journal={Pathologica}, volume={116}, number={6}, pages={404-416}}

results.title: Combined Topiramate and Metformin Pharmacotherapy for Second-Generation Antipsychotic-Induced Weight Gain in Pediatric Bipolar Disorder and Aggression.
results.text_hl: Combined @CHEMICAL_Topiramate @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077236 @@@Topiramate@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ Pharmacotherapy for Second-Generation Antipsychotic-Induced Weight @DISEASE_Weight_Gain @DISEASE_MESH:D015430 @@@Gain@@@ in Pediatric @DISEASE_Bipolar_Disorder @DISEASE_MESH:D001714 @@@Bipolar Disorder@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Personality_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010554 @@@Aggression@@@.

citations.NLM: Nagy LR, Rice T, Coffey BJ. Combined Topiramate and Metformin Pharmacotherapy for Second-Generation Antipsychotic-Induced Weight Gain in Pediatric Bipolar Disorder and Aggression. J Child Adolesc Psychopharmacol. 2022 Feb;32(1):72-76. PMID: 35166568

results.title: Protective Effects of Metformin Against Biochemical Failure Following Radical Prostatectomy or Radiation Therapy in Localized Prostate Cancer.
results.text_hl: @SPECIES_9606 @@@Patients@@@ on @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ were significantly older, had higher body mass indexes, and more @<m>DISEASE_Personality_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010554 @@@aggressive disease@@@ (Gleason score >7).

citations.NLM: Huynh LM, Keit E, Huang E, Carrillo RC, Ahlering TE, Boyle S, Enke CA, Baine M. Protective Effects of Metformin Against Biochemical Failure Following Radical Prostatectomy or Radiation Therapy in Localized Prostate Cancer. Urology. 2021 Sep;155():172-178. PMID: 33515557
